results.title: Purple rain
results.creator_credit: Albert Magnoli, Joseph Ruffalo, Steven Fargnoli, Robert Cavallo and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Long before he was the Artist Formally Known As…, Prince’s debut feature is a thinly disguised semi-autobiographical account of the rise of a Minneapolis musician called the Kid. ‘Purple Rain’s‘ threadbare plot mines familiar territory as it recounts The Kids struggle to break away from his destructive family and come into his own musically with his special brand of electronic rock. Throw in the obligatory romance with an aspiring singer (Apollonia Kotero) and a long standing feud with a rival band (Morris Day and The Time), and that pretty much sums it up. Where the film shines however is in its great concert sequences and the brilliant music score (Prince won an Oscar for his efforts) performed and provided by Prince and his band The Revolution. Cast also includes Morris Day, Olga Karlatos, Clarence Williams the third, Wendy Melvoin, Lisa Coleman, Bobby Z, Matt Fink, Brown Mark and Jerome Benton. (Awards: 1985 Academy Award- Best Music, original Score Song- Prince)

results.title: Purple haze
results.creator_credit: Rachael Hynes, Katherine Hynes, Ian Stevenson and Bondi Beech
results.brief_description: This documentary follows the story of 5 Jacaranda Queen candidates in the country town of Grafton, NSW, before and after the crowning. It examines all the trials and tribulations of preparing for the ceremony and coping with not only losing, but winning. Their candid experience is reflected against the background of Grafton, a town living through tough economic times, the community expectation of the events, and the impact or relevance it has on their lives. Produced with assistance from the Australian Film Finance Corporation.

results.title: Puritan family of early New England
results.brief_description: A class-room film, describing the daily activities of a Puritan family living in a New England coastal village. Shows the father hunting and dressing skins, the mother making soap, candles and cornbread, and the children spinning, digging clams, and doing school work. Explains the importance of religion in daily life and the dependence of the early settlers upon each other.

results.title: Pure steam: The Flying Scotsman in Australia (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Henshaw, Jim Revitt and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: For almost a year the world’s most famous working steam locomotive, The Flying Scotsman 4472, from Britain, thrilled Australian steam enthusiasts from coast to coast. During 1988/89 4472 visited five Australian states and the Northern Territory. Its spectacular parallel runs, double-heading and solo trips have been brilliantly recorded by camera crews from ABC TV, from the air, trackside and on board.

results.title: Pure Luck
results.creator_credit: Peter Wooley, Grania Preston, Lance Hool, Nadia Tass, Timothy Harris, Herschel Weingrod, Sean Daniel, Silver Lion Films, Sean Daniel Company and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: An accountant with super bad luck is sent in search of a missing boss’s daughter, also an incredibly unlucky.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Wooley, Grania Preston, Lance Hool, Nadia Tass, Timothy Harris, Herschel Weingrod, Sean Daniel, Silver Lion Films, Sean Daniel Company and Universal Pictures
results.description: The daughter of a wealthy businessman has disappeared in Mexico, and all the efforts to find her have been unsuccessful. A psychologist, knowing that the girl has an ultra bad luck, persuades her father to send to Mexico one of his employees, an accountant with super bad luck, to find her. Perhaps he will be lucky, and his bad luck could help to find the unlucky girl.

results.title: Puppetry: string marionettes
results.creator_credit: Frank Haines and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes the making of a puppet in detail from the carving of the head to the fitting of the strings. Close-ups show how the movements of the various limbs are achieved and finally the film portrays a brief episode in the story of Hansel and Gretel.

results.title: Puppeteer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
Depicts the modified way of life of a traditional Rajasthan puppeteer in Vdaipur today. Living in a tent on a street corner, Bansilal works in a superb Maharajah’s Palace, now converted to a five star hotel.
